description.narrative: The programme is the second phase of Danish support for the implementation of the Malian sectorial programme for water and sanitation. The common finance agreement between the Government of Mali, Denmark and Sweden has been terminated, with Denmark as the only donor going forward. The programme has been prolonged until 2015 in a first time and a new prolongation has been fixed to end 2016. All the components of the programme are now included in a national transition programme through water and sanitation thematic programme. The programme aims at reducing poverty through improved access to clean water and sanitation. Hygiene and sanitation component infrastructures (public latrine, school latrine, water flow drainage, information and building capacities for public latrine management) have been almost constructed during in 2014 and the remaining activities will be ended in the first semester 2015. The programme was re-started in 2013, following an extensive reprogramming. The main implementing partners are now the private sector and parastatal organisations (AGETIER and SOMAPEP) and UNICEF. Water supply for rural areas, aiming at strengthening and securing access to drinking water for 216,400 persons in three regions; Water supply for urban aims ensure safe drinking water providing and access to 278,800 people of 390,000 without access to water services in four Malian towns ( kayes, Koutiala, Kati and Sikasso) . In these towns, priority will be focused to provide potable water to poorest by promotional connections to water supply and more public water standpipes.

sector.narrative: Water supply and sanitation - large systems
